class_notes:
(Same as AAS 320R 1, AFS 389 1)
This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Region.
This course will examine African heritage religions in the Caribbean. Some of the religious traditions we will cover include: Vodou, Regla de Palo, Obeah, and Regla de Ocha (Lucumí or Santería. Attention will be given to historical processes that shaped how these religions developed in their diasporic contexts. In addition to obtaining a foundational understanding of the beliefs and practices associated with each tradition, we will consider some of the contemporary approaches to studying African heritage religions in the African diaspora.
course_description: Development of religion among African Americans; trends and tendencies.
